PV = PMT x (1 + r)^n
Where:
PV = Present Value (the amount paid today)
PMTS = Monthly Payment
r = Interest Rate (annual rate divided by 12)
n = Number of periods (in this case, 3 months or 1/4 year)

Now we can calculate the monthly payment using the formula above:
Monthly Payment = PV / (1 + r)^n
= $750 / (1 + 0.02)^3
= $750 / 1.02^3
= $750 / 1.0608
= $709.04
